title: If five times a number is subtracted from twice the square of the number, the result is 63. What is the number? - Quora

response.answer_text: x={-9/2,7} PREMISES 2x^2-5x=63 ASSUMPTIONS Let x=the number CALCULATIONS 2x^2–5x=63 2x^2–5x-63=63–63 2x^2–5x-63=0 (Factor the polynomial and solve for the unknown “x” or if that is not possible, use the quadratic formula to solve) 2x^2–5x-63=0 can be factored: (2x+9)(x-7)=0 Now, either 2x+9=0 and/or x-7=0 If 2x+9=0, then x=-9/2 If x-7=0, then x=7 So, tentatively, x= {-9/2,7} Test x={-9/2,7} in the original equation to see whether they are valid roots (zeros) First, x=-9/2 2[(-9/2)^2]–5(-9/2)=63 2(81/4)-(-45/2)=63 162/4+45/2=63 (Convert the fractions to the common denominator 4) 162/4+90/4=63 (162+90)/4=63 252/4=63 and 63=63 x=-9/2 checks out as a valid root of the expression Second, x=7 2(7^2)-5(7)=63 2(49)-35=63 98–35=63 and 63=63 x=7 checks out as a valid root of the expression CONCLUSION(S) x= {-9/2,7} C.H.

2n^2–5n=63 subtract 63 2n^2–5n-63=0 use the solution to the general quadratic formula: a=2; b=-5; c=-63 {-b +/- sqrt(b^2–4ac)}/2a ={5+/-sqrt(-5^2–4x2x-63)}/2x2= {5+/-sqrt(25+504)}/4 ={5+/-sqrt 529}/4 ={5+/-23}/4 =28/4 or -18/4 =7 or -9/2

The answer is -9/2 and 7 Process…. Let the number be x. According to the question.. 2x^2–5x=63 So, we can write it as 2x^2–5x-63=0 Hence, we have to calculate this by using quadratic equation.. Then we got, (2x+9)(x-7)=0 Either, (2x+9)=0 Or,2x=-9 Or,x=-9/2 OR, (X-7)=0 X=7..And Hope it helps you… Sorry for my late answer

The statement is summarized in the equation 2x^2 - 5x = 63 which we write as 2x^2 - 5x - 63 = 0 This is readily factored to give (2x + 9)(x - 7) = 0. Therefore, the solutions of the original equation are x = -9/2 and x = 7.

List squares. 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49, 64, 81, 100, 132, 144 Keep in mind that the combination equals 63. Try some numbers from the above squares. I had to guess and check 3 times before I found the correct number. 2n^2 - 5n = 63 2(7^2)- 5(7) =63 98- 35 =63 The number is 7.

By analyzing the problem, I see that X (the number) is less than 10 because 2*10^2 is 200 minus 50 (5X) is 150 (greater than 63). so let try 9. We also see that 9*7=63, so those two numbers may be close. Using 9 we now get 2(9)^2=162 -45=117 (still greater than 63, so lets try 7. 2(7^2)-35=98–35=63. 2X^2–5X=63 Solving this equation will also give you 7 and -9/2
Let the number be x 2x^2 - 5x = 63 Hence, 2x^2 - 5x - 63 = 0 Hence, (2x +9 )(x - 7) = 0 Hence, x = -4.5 or 7, neither of which is a square in the usual sense of the word.

Using the J programming language: n#~63=(2*n^2)-5*n=.i.10 7 So the only integer solution is 7. We can look for non-integer solutions: 2n^2-5n-62=0 >}.p. _63 _5 2 — Use J‘s quadratic equation solver. 7 _4.5 So the two solutions are 7 & 4.5.
Let k be your number. Then: 2k²-5k=63 Then: 2k²-5k-63=0 (2k+9)(k-7)=0 k=-9/2 or 7 …………………
